name: Holiday Inn Express Chester-Racecourse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is what is to be expected - clean...very "Ikea-esque", basic, modern.
reviews.title: Does what it has to do well...

reviews.text: Location is superb (literally 3 mins walk from the town centre) and the parking is free which is a bonus. It's also easier to access by car than some of the more "central" hotels - Chester's one-way system can be a nightmare.
reviews.title: Good Hotel - but the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Holiday Innsufficient with Express Bad Attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast - only continental - cereals, yoghurts, juice, breads - not as good as similar hotels where they provide more cold meats as well.
reviews.title: Ideal

reviews.text: The walls are paper-thin though and there was a 40 person stag night at the time - which made for "interesting" unintentional eavesdropping!
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Value

reviews.text: Good Holiday Inn Express which, according to the notice in reception, is operated by the racecourse as a franchise. Located on the edge of the centre of Chester and it is certainly possible to walk into town.
reviews.title: Great Choice for Chester

reviews.text: Rooms are clean and functional. Bathrooms contain only a shower with no baths as per other HI Expresses.
reviews.title: Warmest hotel in town!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The HI Express continental breakfast has expanded is recent years and now includes several hot items.
reviews.title: No complaints

reviews.text: Parking is free in the Racecourse car park. When arriving, they should have your details and will wave you in.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel

reviews.text: There was a party going on in the room next door to us during one evening and my wife had to contact reception serveral times. The receptionist did attend and ask for the volume to be turned down and at 11pm they left for a night on the town. We had our revenge in the morning!
reviews.title: perfect position

reviews.text: We stay here for one night as it was a hen party,
reviews.title: Hen Party

likes.liked: — Was not in the hotel really just there at bedtime to go sleep

reviews.text: thought the room was clean, it was quite spacouse as well,
reviews.title: Well Located for Town Centre

reviews.text: bar was small but adaqate, the breakfast was ok but could of done with more variaty, cups and glassess for juice and tea kept running out fast and had to wait about for more but apart from that it was a good hotel for a short stay, 5 min walk from centre, fab shops loads for us girls to have a right old spending spree.
reviews.title: Disappointed by housekeeping

likes.liked: — Location, Location, Location ------- and free parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: would defo stay again.
reviews.title: Does what it claims to do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a golf outing for a group of sixteen 30 and 40 something men. For what we were looking for it was fine. The rooms were clean, there was an inside and outside bar area and the hotel was within a five minute walk of the main area of bars and clubs. There was ample car parking in the car park adjacent for the racecourse although this might not be the case on the few occasions in the summer when there is a race meeting.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

likes.liked: — Great service and little extras that you wouldn't expect at a budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very nice hotel next to Chester racecourse, yet only a few minutes walk from Chesters lovely city centre. The hotel was spotless, the staff very friendly and efficient. A good experience all round...
reviews.title: Does everything its supposed to, very well!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel was great. Only a few minutes walk to the city centre. Free parking was a bonus too. I do not expect absolute silence considering a city centre location but in the car park is a recycling factory which has a permanent loud humming noise and on my first night was either sawing or grinding until 2.30am. This was really loud and even closing the window and suffering the heat in my really hot room made no difference. There is also a main trainline literally a stones throw from the hotel window with a train at least every 10mins at all hours. The room looked clean but when I used the shower the water did not drain away. When I checked the plughole it was so bungged up with hair Im not supprised it didn't work. There is no way a cleaner could have accidently missed this. They also missed the stain on the sheets.
reviews.title: Noisest hotel I have stayed in.

reviews.text: We were also unable to get in our room 2 days in a row because the key card did not work. This meant on both occasions waiting for the lift and then waiting for the receptionist to put my card into a machine so it would work again. Although the room was small compared to a premier inn, and so was the bed and wardrobe, the tv was a good size. Other good points were a free ice machine in reception and the breakfast was very nice. The staff were also very friendly.
reviews.title: Very clean in a great location

reviews.text: Excellent location to explore Chester from, only being 5 minutes from Chester Rows, and slightly quicker to the city walls. Parking is free which is a massive plus as not many hotels in Chester offer this!
reviews.title: A Good Budget Hotel in Chester

reviews.text: The room was very clean (twin) although compact (no wardrobe, open hangers?) had a lovely TV with freeview. The desk would have benefited from a mirror (for make up purposes!) Bathroom was clean and a reasonable size, shower was powerful.
reviews.title: Good location if weird architecture
Don't go unless you are on a hen night
reviews.text: We are a group of six middle aged ladies. We arrived here at 11a.m. check out time and asked if they could allocate us three quiet twin rooms next to each other. The receptionist was very off hand said that it was not possible to do that until check in time at 2p.m. By the time we arrived back at the hotel later that afternoon we found that groups of hen night and stag night parties had checked in and one of the rooms allocated to us was on the second floor which was near to one of these groups. The partygoers arrived back very late and made a horrendous noise until 4.30p.m. I cannot understand why it was necessary for us to be physically there in order for our request for the location of the rooms to be granted. The receptionist must have had all the necessary information on the computer. The hotel is in an excellent location for the city centre and is very clean and good value for money. It's a pity about the customer service.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: We stay for 1 night. Booked a family room. 1 sofa bed and 1 double bed. Rooms spotless. Tea & Coffee facilites in room. Comfy Beds. Power Shower. All you need !. Breakfast was included in price ( £ 65 for 4 pax ) Full Kelloggs range, bread, toast, crossants, juices, tea / coffee. Help yourself, as much as you need / want. Perfect for families. Most helpful and pleasant staff. Ample safe parking. Train Track runs beside hotel but can honestly say that I never heard them running. Cots, Highchairs available. Plasma TV in breakfast area / reception. Would stay again and would recommend for everyone ( business / familes, would suit anyone )
When staying at a Holiday Inn Express you sort of know what you are getting. A nice clean room with great shower, a comfy bed and good working area, but not much in the way of food in the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Position

reviews.text: The breakfast is good, the position is brilliant only 5 minutes up the road and you are in the middle of Chester. And it really is at the race course as rooms at the back over look the whole course.
reviews.title: Great Location, New Hotel but Average Value for Money

reviews.text: All in all a good hotel, yes you need to find food elsewhere, but this is why it is called a Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Oh my goodness...big mistake!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just spent a couple of nights in the Holiday Inn Express Chester, It is one of the best hotels for location and value in chester. It is within easy walking distance of the town center, the river and city walls. For those with cars parking is free and access to the motorway is only minutes away. The rooms are clean and the breakfast better than most value hotels. The hotel is close to a railway line (our room was only meters away from the line itself) but i must say that this didn't cause us any discomfort as the hotel seems to be well sound proofed, i actually noticed the sound of birds before i noticed the sound of the railway. I would certainly stay in this hotel again when next in Chester.
reviews.title: Would go back tomorrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this the night before for my husband and myself, arrived 5.30 pm (parking included) handy as parking in Chester can be expensive. Lovely room overlooking the racecourse, spacious and very clean.
reviews.title: last minute booking and well worth it

reviews.text: Breakfast the following morning was ok, not much choice/vary basic but ok what do you expect for £69 B&B for 2.
reviews.title: Can't complain about anything

reviews.text: Would I stay again yes!!
reviews.title: Good quality budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally located 5 minutes up the road for the bars/restaurants.
reviews.title: great stay,

reviews.text: Stayed here many times over the years and found the staff friendly & professional.
reviews.title: Perfect and exactly what it says it is.

reviews.text: Recommend this to anyone - It aint a boutique - It's a HI Express - good VFM as booked a couple of months before.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights arriving early at 10am although the room wasn't ready when I arrived due to the hotel being full the night before. I was offered to help myself to breakfast free of charge while I waited for my room which was great after traveling for 4 hours.
reviews.title: Suspect cleaning!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The team them gave me all the information I needed about the city centre and a map.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Express Chester-Racecourse

reviews.text: When I got back in the staff greeted me and asked how I enjoyed my stay and told me they had put my luggage in my room for me .
reviews.title: Excellent budget hotel

aka: Holiday Inn Express Chester-Racecourse Hotel Chester
description: Combine good value with a great location at Holiday Inn Express Chester Racecourse, the only hotel within the racecourse's grounds.Holiday Inn Express Chester Racecourse is a completely non smoking hotel and just 5 minutes from Chester's historic city centre, putting quaint cobbled streets and an array of shops and restaurants within walking distance. Wake up to our complimentary breakfast and enjoy discounts on dinner at the racecourse's smart Restaurant 1539. You'll also benefit from complimentary onsite parking and complimentary wireless Internet in the hotel's public areas.We're a 5-minute drive from major companies in Chester Business Park, and 15 minutes from Deeside Industrial Park. You can hold training days for up to 25 people in Holiday Inn Express Chester Racecourse's 2 meeting rooms. Feel free to plan your presentation in our 24-hour self-service Business Centre.We're the closest hotel to Chester Racecourse, making us an ideal choice for your day at the races. Soak up Chester's rich history with a stroll down picturesque Watergate Street where grand Georgian buildings nestle alongside fine antique shops. Explore the city's Roman walls to enjoy views over the Cheshire countryside.Ask our friendly staff about Holiday Inn Express Chester Racecourse's packages for discounted entry to local attractions. You can meet and mingle with friends at our bar at the end of a day's sightseeing.Please contact the hotel directly for group bookings and race day packages.
